events.name: Lithium-Ion Recycling
events.wd_description: Three main methods are used in lithium-ion recycling: pyrometallurgical, hydrometallurgical, bioleaching, and direct recycling.
events.description: Three main methods are used in lithium-ion recycling: pyrometallurgical, hydrometallurgical, bioleaching, and direct recycling.

events.name: Pyrometallurgical
events.wd_description: Employs extreme heat to transform metal oxides into cobalt, copper, iron, and nickel alloys.
events.description: Employs extreme heat to transform metal oxides into cobalt, copper, iron, and nickel alloys.

events.name: Hydrometallurgical
events.wd_description: Uses aqueous solutions to leach targeted metals out from the cathode substance.
events.description: Uses aqueous solutions to leach targeted metals out from the cathode substance.

events.name: Bioleaching
events.wd_description: Uses bacteria to retrieve precious metals.
events.description: Uses bacteria to retrieve precious metals.

events.name: Non-Battery Demand Subsystem
events.wd_description: The non-battery demand subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs and provides market competition to the LiB sector for Ni resources.
events.description: The non-battery demand subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs and provides market competition to the LiB sector for Ni resources.

events.name: Non-Battery Demand
events.wd_description: The subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs.
events.description: The subsystem models all demand for Ni products that are not specifically LiBs.

events.name: Stainless Steel Industry
events.wd_description: Stainless steel feedstocks can be flexible, using either class 1 or class 2, but some amount of class 1 is necessary to adjust purity levels.
events.description: Stainless steel feedstocks can be flexible, using either class 1 or class 2, but some amount of class 1 is necessary to adjust purity levels.

events.name: Historical Driver
events.wd_description: The non-battery demand subsystem has historically driven the Ni supply chain.
events.description: The non-battery demand subsystem has historically driven the Ni supply chain.

events.name: Market competition with LiB sector
events.description: The non-battery demand subsystem provides market competition to the LiB sector for Ni resources and has historically driven the Ni supply chain.

events.name: Class 1 loading rate
events.description: Stainless steel feedstocks require some amount of class 1 nickel to adjust purity levels, which is relevant to the availability of nickel for LiB production.
